1.q_string:
There are four elements \(\mathrm{p}, \mathrm{q}, \mathrm{r}\) and s having atomic numbers \(\mathrm{Z}-1, \mathrm{Z}, \mathrm{Z}+\) 1 and \(\mathrm{Z}+2\) respectively. If the element \(\mathrm{q}\) is an inert gas, select the correct statements:

(i) p has most negative electron gain enthalpy in the respective period.

(ii) r is an alkali metal.

(iii) s exists in \(+2\) oxidation state.

The electron affinity increases on moving from left to right along a period. Arrange the reasons in a proper sequence:

(a) The amount of energy released during the addition of an electrons increases from left to right along a period.

(b) Effective nuclear charge of the elements increases from left to right.

(c) The atomic size of the elements decreases from left to right.

(d) The tendency to gain electrons and form anion increases from left to right.

q_option: Addition of electron in oxygen results in larger size of the ion
Electron repulsion outweighs the stability gained by achieving noble gas configuration
\(\mathrm{O}^{-}\)ion has comparatively smaller size than oxygen atom.
1.q_string:
The formation of the oxide ion, \(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{2-}\), from oxygen atom requires first an exothermic and then an endothermic step as shown below:

\(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-} ; \Delta \mathrm{H}^{\circ}=-141 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\)

\(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{2-} ; \Delta \mathrm{H}^{\circ}=+780 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\)

Thus, process of formation of \(\mathrm{O}^{2-}\) in gas phase is unfavourable even though \(\mathrm{O}^{2-}\) is isoelectronic with neon. It is due to the fact that:
Among \(\mathrm{Al}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}, \mathrm{SiO}_{2}, \mathrm{P}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{SO}_{2}\) the correct order of acid strength is:

Which of the following order(s) for electron affinity is(are) correct?

(a) \(\mathrm{S}>\mathrm{O}<\mathrm{Se}\)

(b) \(\mathrm{CI}>\mathrm{F}\)

(c) \(\mathrm{S}>\mathrm{O}\)

(d) \(\mathrm{O}>\mathrm{S}\)

(e) \(\mathrm{N}>\mathrm{P}\)

(f) \(\mathrm{C}>\mathrm{N}\)
The correct sequence of the electron affinity of \(\mathrm{C}, \mathrm{N}, \mathrm{O}\) and \(\mathrm{F}\) is:

q_option: Addition of electron in oxygen results in larger size of the ion
Eelectron repulsion outweighs the stability gained by achieving noble gas configuration
\(\mathrm{O}^{-}\)ion has comparatively smaller size than oxygen atom
1.q_string:
The formation of the oxide ion, \(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{2-}\), from oxygen atom requires first an exothermic and then an endothermic step as shown below:

\(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-} ; \Delta \mathrm{H}^{\circ}=-141 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\)

\(\mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{O}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{2-} ; \Delta \mathrm{H}^{\circ}=+780 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}\)

Thus, process of formation of \(\mathrm{O}^{2-}\) in gas phase is unfavourable even though \(\mathrm{O}^{2-}\) is isoelectronic with neon. It is due to the fact that:

q_option: Assertion and reason both are correct statements and reason is the correct explanation for assertion.
Assertion and reason both are correct statements but the reason is not the correct explanation for assertion.
Assertion is correct statement but reason is wrong statement.
Assertion and reason both are wrong statements.
1.q_string:
Choose the correct option according to the question:

Assertion:

According to Mendeleev, the properties of elements are a periodic function of their atomic weights.

Reason:

Mendeleev left the gap under aluminium and a gap under silicon, and called these elements Eka-Aluminium and Eka-Silicon.

The amount of energy when a million atoms of iodine are completely converted into I' ions in the vapor state according to the equation,

\(\mathrm {I}_{(\mathrm{g})}\) \(+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{I}_{(\mathrm{g})}^{-}\)is \(4.9 \times 10^{-13} \mathrm{~J}\). What would be the electron gain enthalpy of odine in terms of \(\mathrm{kJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) and \(\mathrm{eV}\) per atom?
The correct order of electron affinity is:

Electron gain enthalpy of 17th group elements are \(-349,-328,-325,-296,-270 \mathrm{~kJ} / \mathrm{mol}\) (not in order). The element which has electron gain enthalpy \(-296 \mathrm{~kJ} / \mathrm{mol}\) is:

q_option: Both Assertion and Reason are correct and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion
Both Assertion and Reason are correct but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion
Assertion is correct but Reason is incorrect
1.q_string:
Assertion:

The \(5^{\text {th }}\) period of periodic table contains 18 elements not 32 .

Reason:

\(\mathrm{n}=5, \mathrm{l}=0,12,3\). The order in which the energy of available orbitals

\(4 \mathrm{~d}, 5 \mathrm{~s}\), and \(5 \mathrm{p}\) increases is \(5 \mathrm{~s}<4 \mathrm{~d}<5 \mathrm{p}\) and the total number of orbitals available are 9 and thus 18 electrons can be accommodated.
Beryllium and aluminium exhibit many properties which are similar. But, the two elements differ in:
Among \(\mathrm{Al}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}, \mathrm{SiO}_{2}, \mathrm{P}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{SO}_{2}\) the correct order of acid strength is:

IP values and EA values of elements A, B, C and D are given in a tabular form. Identify the strongest oxidizing agent and reducing agent among them.
 IP Value EA Value
 A) 450140
 B) 225700 
 C) 300400
